Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Pomp \Pomp\, n. [OE. pompe, F. pompe, L. pompa, fr. Gr. ? a sending, a solemn procession, pomp, fr. ? to send. Cf. {Pump} a shoe.] 1. A procession distinguished by ostentation and splendor; a pageant. ``All the pomps of a Roman triumph.'' --Addison. [1913 Webster]
2. Show of magnificence; parade; display; power. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Display; parade; pageant; pageantry; splendor; state; magnificence; ostentation; grandeur; pride. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pomp \Pomp\, v. i. To make a pompons display; to conduct. [Obs.] --B. Jonson. [1913 Webster]
pomp n : ceremonial elegance and splendor; "entered with much eclat in a coach drawn by eight white horses" [syn: {eclat}]
